name: Biscuits and Gravy Casserole
author: Angela
summary: I got this recipe at a church potluck. All the flavors blend really well. I've made it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. So far every time I've served it, I haven't had any leftovers. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 (10 ounce) can refrigerated biscuit dough (such as Pillsbury Grands!®)
1 ½ cups shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 ½ cups cold water, or more as needed
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line the bottom of the prepared baking dish with biscuits
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook and stir sausage in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease
Scatter sausage over biscuit layer and top with 1 cup Cheddar cheese
Whisk eggs, milk, salt, and pepper together in a bowl and pour over cheese layer
Mix water and gravy mix together in a saucepan; bring to a boil
Reduce heat and simmer until gravy is thickened, 1 to 2 minutes, adding more water for a thinner gravy
Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese over casserole
Bake in the preheated oven until egg is fluffy and cheese is bubbling, about 30 minutes
